page.title: 05BARLASTON -RELIGION
page.content: The original church of St John The Baptist in Barlaston was situated on the outskirts of the village and over the last few years suffered severe structural damage due to mine workings underground. A temporary church was built along side and was used until November 1984 when the new church was opened near the centre of the village. The finance for this building came from the National coalboard and great care was taken with the foundations to ensure this did not happen again. The original six bells from the old church have been transfered to the new building which are rung regularly by the bell ringing team. Church activities include Mother's Union an active church choir and a youth club for the teen ages.
